title: 114_hr2399
content: The Act is titled the "Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee Act." It amends the Fish and Wildlife Coordination Act by adding a section establishing the Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee (Advisory Committee) is established to advise the Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture on wildlife conservation, hunting, and recreational shooting. Its duties include advising on the implementation of Executive Order No. 13443 to expand hunting opportunities, conserve habitats, and promote conservation programs. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee advises on wildlife conservation, hunting, and recreational shooting. It focuses on promoting hunting opportunities, conserving habitats, recruiting new hunters, increasing public awareness of conservation benefits, and encouraging coordination among various stakeholders. The committee consists of discretionary and ex officio members. The ex officio members of the Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee include representatives from the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, Bureau of Land Management, National Park Service, Forest Service, and Natural Resources Conservation Service. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee includes ex officio members from various government agencies and discretionary members appointed jointly by the Secretaries from different organizations related to wildlife and hunting. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee includes ex officio members from government agencies and discretionary members appointed by the Secretaries from organizations supporting sustainable-use hunting and wildlife conservation. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee members are appointed for 4-year terms, with limits on consecutive or nonconsecutive terms. Initial appointees have staggered terms of 4, 3, or 2 years as designated by the Secretary. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee members are appointed for 4-year terms, with limits on consecutive or nonconsecutive terms. No individual may be appointed while serving as a federal government officer or employee. Vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment, and members serve at the discretion of the Secretaries. Appointed members can continue to serve until a successor is appointed, and the Chairperson is designated. The Chairperson of the Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee is appointed for a 3-year term by the Secretaries. Members serve without pay but can be reimbursed for travel expenses. Meetings are scheduled by the Secretaries and the chairperson. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee meets at the call of the Secretaries or chairperson, at least twice annually. Meetings are open to the public, with prior notice published in the Federal Register and trade publications. The Committee may establish workgroups for compiling information or research, but they require direction from the Advisory Committee. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee must conduct business under the direction of the Advisory Committee, with nine members constituting a quorum. Expenses are paid by the Secretaries, and a designated Federal Officer provides administrative support. An annual report is required to be submitted by September 30 each year. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee must submit an annual report by September 30 to specified House and Senate Committees. The report should detail the Committee's activities, reports, and recommendations from the previous year. The Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council Advisory Committee must submit an annual report detailing activities, reports, and recommendations from the previous year. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Advisory Committee. The existing Wildlife and Hunting Heritage Conservation Council will continue until the first meeting of the new Council established by the amendment, after which it will be abolished.
